conclusion: Analyze the cyclic process of the ideal gas focusing on pressure and volume relationship.
The image shows a pressure-volume (p-V) diagram for an ideal gas undergoing a cyclic process from state A to B to C to D and back to A.
Since it is a cyclic process, the net change in internal energy is zero, implying the change in temperature is also zero.
Given the temperature of state A is 27°C, the temperature at state B must also be 27°C due to the cyclic nature.
The temperature \(T_B\) of state B is 27°C.
